Name: The Alice Dataset: fMRI Dataset to Study Natural Language Comprehension in the Brain
Acknowledgments: We acknowledge with appreciation the help of David Lutz, Frederick Callaway, Elana Feldman, Jaclyn Jeffrey-Wilensky, and Adam Mahar. We thank Emily Qualls for assistance with data collection.
ReferencesAndLinks: Bhattasali, S., Brennan, J. R, Luh, W. M., Franzluebber, B., & Hale, J. T. (2020). The Alice Datasets: fMRI & EEG Observations of Natural Language Comprehension. In Proceedings of the Twelfth International Conference on Language Resources and Evaluation (LREC 2020)

Brennan et al. (2016) Abstract linguistic structure correlates with temporal activity during naturalistic comprehension. Brain and Language Volumes 157–158: Pages 81-94. doi:10.1016/j.bandl.2016.04.008
HowToAcknowledge:
When using this dataset, please cite:
Bhattasali, S., Brennan, J. R, Luh, W. M., Franzluebbers, B., & Hale, J. T. (2020). The Alice Datasets: fMRI & EEG Observations of Natural Language Comprehension. In Proceedings of the Twelfth International Conference on Language Resources and Evaluation (LREC 2020)
